DE_transcript: Ich hatte es wohl verstanden; der Vater hat sich für den Sohn geopfert, und da er ihm nichts mehr zu geben hat als sein Leben, so giebt er ihm dieses.
EN_transcript: JANUARY th.I understood it all; the devoted father having nothing more to give, had given his life for his son.

DE_transcript: Doch alle jene Verhungerten wollen nicht warten, und der Schmerz in ihren Eingeweiden verdoppelt sich in Gegenwart des ihnen zugefallenen Schlachtopfers.
EN_transcript: M. Letourneur was no longer a human being in the eyes of the famished creatures who were now yearning to see him sacrificed to their cravings.

DE_transcript: Soll man es mit ansehen, daß sie sich auf ihr Opfer stürzen und es lebend verschlingen?
EN_transcript: At the very sight of the victim thus provided, all the tortures of hunger returned with redoubled violence.

DE_transcript: Wer sollte glauben, daß Jemand noch jetzt einen Appell an das Restchen von Menschlichkeit in Jenen wagen, und vorzüglich, daß er gehört werden würde?
EN_transcript: With lips distended, and teeth displayed, they waited like a herd of carnivora until they could attack their prey with brutal voracity; it seemed almost doubtful whether they would not fall upon him while he was still alive.

DE_transcript: Ja! ein Wort war doch im Stande, ihnen in dem Augenblicke Halt zu gebieten, da sie sich auf Mr. Letourneur stürzen wollten, und der Hochbootsmann, in Begriff als Fleischer zu dienen, sowie Daoulas mit der Axt in der Hand sind plötzlich still stehen geblieben.
EN_transcript: It seemed impossible that any appeal to their humanity could, at such a moment, have any weight; nevertheless, the appeal was made, and, incredible as it may seem, prevailed.

DE_transcript: Miß Herbey geht oder schleppt sich vielmehr auf Jene zu.
EN_transcript: Just as the boatswain was about to act the part of butcher, and Dowlas stood, hatchet in hand, ready to complete the barbarous work, Miss Herbey advanced, or rather crawled, towards them.

DE_transcript: Meine Freunde, beginnt sie, wollt Ihr noch einen einzigen Tag warten?
EN_transcript: My friends, she pleaded, will you not wait just one more day?

DE_transcript: Nur einen Tag!
EN_transcript: If no land or ship is in sight tomorrow, then I suppose our poor companion must become your victim.

DE_transcript: Wenn bis morgen kein Land sich zeigt, kein Schiff uns begegnet ist, so mag unser armer Gefährte Euch als Beute gehören?.Bei diesen Worten wird mein Herz wieder lebendiger.
EN_transcript: <MERGE> If no land or ship is in sight tomorrow, then I suppose our poor companion must become your victim.

DE_transcript: Mir scheint es, als spräche das junge Mädchen in einem so zuversichtlich prophetischen Tone, und als sei es die Eingebung eines Höheren, welche diese edle Seele antreibt.
EN_transcript: Just as the boatswain was about to act the part of butcher, and Dowlas stood, hatchet in hand, ready to complete the barbarous work, Miss Herbey advanced, or rather crawled, towards them.

DE_transcript: O, wie kehrt die Hoffnung wieder in mein Herz ein.
EN_transcript: My heart bounded as she made her pitiful appeal.

DE_transcript: Die Küste, das Schiff, gewiß hat Miß Herbey sie schon in einer übernatürlichen Vision gesehen, welche Gott seinen Auserwählten manchmal sendet.
EN_transcript: If no land or ship is in sight tomorrow, then I suppose our poor companion must become your victim.

DE_transcript: Was will ein Tag bedeuten, gegenüber den Qualen, welche wir schon erduldet haben?
EN_transcript: But allow him one more day; in the name of mercy I entreat, I implore you.

DE_transcript: Robert Kurtis ist auch meiner Meinung; wir vereinigen unsere Bitten mit denen der Miß Herbey, Falsten spricht in demselben Sinne, wir flehen unsere Gefährten, den Hochbootsmann, Daoulas, die Anderen an.
EN_transcript: The sailors did not utter a murmur, and the boatswain in a smothered voice said, Very well, we will wait till daybreak tomorrow, and threw down his hatchet.

DE_transcript: Die Matrosen halten schweigend ein.
EN_transcript: <MERGE> The sailors did not utter a murmur, and the boatswain in a smothered voice said, Very well, we will wait till daybreak tomorrow, and threw down his hatchet.

DE_transcript: Der Hochbootsmann wirft die Axt weg und murmelt.
EN_transcript: My heart bounded as she made her pitiful appeal.

DE_transcript: Also bis morgen mit Anbruch des Tages!.Dieses Wort sagt Alles.
EN_transcript: <MERGE> The sailors did not utter a murmur, and the boatswain in a smothered voice said, Very well, we will wait till daybreak tomorrow, and threw down his hatchet.

DE_transcript: Wenn sich morgen weder das Land noch ein Schiff zeigt, wird das schreckliche Opfer gebracht werden.
EN_transcript: Tomorrow, then, unless land or a sail appear, the horrible sacrifice will be accomplished.

DE_transcript: Jeder kehrt nach seinem Platze zurück und unterdrückt seine Schmerzen mit dem Aufgebot der letzten Kräfte.
EN_transcript: Curtis and Falsten agreed with me, and we all united to support Miss Herbey's merciful petition.

DE_transcript: Die Matrosen verbergen sich unter den Segelstücken und haben gar kein Interesse mehr daran, nach dem Meere auszuschauen.
EN_transcript: The sailors crouched beneath the sails, caring nothing about scanning the ocean.

DE_transcript: Sie sind gleichgiltig geworden, morgen werden sie ja essen.
EN_transcript: Food was in store for them tomorrow, and that was enough for them.

DE_transcript: Inzwischen ist André Letourneur wieder zu sich gekommen, und mit dem ersten Blicke sucht er seinen Vater.
EN_transcript: Tomorrow, then, unless land or a sail appear, the horrible sacrifice will be accomplished.

DE_transcript: Dann sehe ich, wie er die Insassen des Flosses zählt.
EN_transcript: <MERGE> As soon as Andre Letourneur came to his senses, his first thought was for his father, and I saw him count the passengers on the raft.

DE_transcript: Es fehlt nicht Einer.
EN_transcript: <MERGE> As soon as Andre Letourneur came to his senses, his first thought was for his father, and I saw him count the passengers on the raft.

DE_transcript: Auf wen ist das Loos nun gefallen?
EN_transcript: He looked puzzled; when he lost consciousness there had been only two names left in the hat, those of his father and the carpenter; and yet M. Letourneur and Dowlas were both there still.

DE_transcript: Als André das Bewußtsein verlor, verblieben nur noch zwei Namen, der des Zimmermanns und der seines Vaters, im Hute!
EN_transcript: The sailors crouched beneath the sails, caring nothing about scanning the ocean.

DE_transcript: Und Mr. Letourneur so gut wie Daoulas sind doch Beide noch da!
EN_transcript: Food was in store for them tomorrow, and that was enough for them.

DE_transcript: Miß Herbey nähert sich dem jungen Manne und sagt ihm einfach, daß die Loosziehung nicht beendet worden sei.
EN_transcript: Miss Herbey went up to him and told him quietly that the drawing of the lots had not yet been finished.

DE_transcript: Letourneur verlangt nicht mehr zu wissen und ergreift die Hand seines Vaters.
EN_transcript: He looked puzzled; when he lost consciousness there had been only two names left in the hat, those of his father and the carpenter; and yet M. Letourneur and Dowlas were both there still.

DE_transcript: Das Gesicht des Mr. Letourneur hat einen ruhigen, fast lächelnden Ausdruck.
EN_transcript: M. Letourneur's countenance was calm and serene; he seemed to be conscious of nothing except that the life of his son was spared, and as the two sat conversing in an undertone at the back of the raft, their whole existence seemed bound up in each other.

DE_transcript: Er sieht nichts, er versteht nichts Anderes, als daß sein Sohn gerettet ist.
EN_transcript: <MERGE> M. Letourneur's countenance was calm and serene; he seemed to be conscious of nothing except that the life of his son was spared, and as the two sat conversing in an undertone at the back of the raft, their whole existence seemed bound up in each other.

DE_transcript: Diese beiden so innig verbundenen Wesen sitzen im Hintertheile und sprechen leise mit einander.
EN_transcript: Andre asked no further question, but took his father's hand.

DE_transcript: Doch ich muß noch einmal auf den ersten Eindruck zurückkommen, den das Dazwischentreten des jungen Mädchens in mir hinterließ.
EN_transcript: Meantime, I could not disabuse my mind of the impression caused by Miss Herbey's intervention.

DE_transcript: Ich glaube jetzt an eine Hilfe durch die Vorsehung, und ich vermag nicht zu sagen, bis zu welcher Tiefe dieser Gedanke in meinem Gehirn sich festwurzelt.
EN_transcript: Meantime, I could not disabuse my mind of the impression caused by Miss Herbey's intervention.

DE_transcript: Ich möchte behaupten, daß wir vor dem Ende unseres Elendes stehen, und daß das Land oder ein Schiff dort, einige Meilen unter dem Winde, sein müssen; so sicher bin ich dieser Hoffnung!
EN_transcript: <MERGE> Something told me that help was near at hand, and that we were approaching the termination of our suspense and misery; the chimeras that were floating through my brain resolved themselves into realities, so that nothing appeared to me more certain than that either land or sail, be they miles away, would be discovered somewhere to leeward.

DE_transcript: Erstaune
EN_transcript: <MERGE> Something told me that help was near at hand, and that we were approaching the termination of our suspense and misery; the chimeras that were floating through my brain resolved themselves into realities, so that nothing appeared to me more certain than that either land or sail, be they miles away, would be discovered somewhere to leeward.

DE_transcript: Niemand über diesen Umschlag in mir.
EN_transcript: <MERGE> Something told me that help was near at hand, and that we were approaching the termination of our suspense and misery; the chimeras that were floating through my brain resolved themselves into realities, so that nothing appeared to me more certain than that either land or sail, be they miles away, would be discovered somewhere to leeward.

DE_transcript: Mein Gehirn ist so schwach, daß Chimären in ihm jetzt zur Wirklichkeit werden.
EN_transcript: <MERGE> Something told me that help was near at hand, and that we were approaching the termination of our suspense and misery; the chimeras that were floating through my brain resolved themselves into realities, so that nothing appeared to me more certain than that either land or sail, be they miles away, would be discovered somewhere to leeward.

DE_transcript: Ich spreche den Mr. Letourneur von meinen Ahnungen.
EN_transcript: I imparted my convictions to M. Letourneur and his son.

DE_transcript: Wenn er wüßte, daß morgen.
EN_transcript: <MERGE> Andre was as sanguine as myself; poor boy! he little thinks what a loss there is in store for him tomorrow.

DE_transcript: Der Vater hört mir ernsthaft zu und bestärkt mich noch in meiner Hoffnung.
EN_transcript: <MERGE> Andre was as sanguine as myself; poor boy! he little thinks what a loss there is in store for him tomorrow.

DE_transcript: Er glaubt gern und sagt es wenigstens, daß der Himmel die Ueberlebenden verschonen werde, und er überhäuft seinen Sohn mit Liebkosungen, mit den letzten des zärtlichen Vaterherzens.
EN_transcript: His father listened gravely to all we said, and whatever he might think in his own mind, he did not give us any discouragement; Heaven, he said, he was sure would still spare the survivors of the Chancellor, and then he lavished on his son caresses which he deemed to be his last.

DE_transcript: Später, als ich mit ihm allein war, neigte sich Mr. Letourneur dicht zu mir.
EN_transcript: <MERGE> His father listened gravely to all we said, and whatever he might think in his own mind, he did not give us any discouragement; Heaven, he said, he was sure would still spare the survivors of the Chancellor, and then he lavished on his son caresses which he deemed to be his last.

DE_transcript: Ich, ich bin ganz Hoffnung.
EN_transcript: Some time afterwards, when I was alone with him, M. Letourneur whispered in my ear, Mr. Kazallon, I commend my boy to your care, and mark you, he must never know His voice was choked with tears, and he could not finish his sentence.

DE_transcript: Ohne mich einen Augenblick abzuwenden, betrachte ich den Horizont und durchlaufe ihn mit den Blicken in seinem ganzen Umfange.
EN_transcript: <MERGE> Some time afterwards, when I was alone with him, M. Letourneur whispered in my ear, Mr. Kazallon, I commend my boy to your care, and mark you, he must never know His voice was choked with tears, and he could not finish his sentence.
